alert.note: Alert for Big Belt, Bridger and Castle Mountains; Canyon Ferry Area; Cascade County below 5000ft; Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton; Little Belt and Highwood Mountains; Meagher County Valleys; Southern High Plains; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 9:13PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong winds will impact portions of southeastern Pondera, northeastern Broadwater, northwestern Meagher, eastern Teton, southwestern Chouteau and Cascade Counties through 1000 PM MDT... At 912 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking an outflow boundary from collapsing strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles south of Choteau to near Fort Shaw to 8 miles east of Cascade to 15 miles northeast of Townsend. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Choteau, Fairfield, Dutton, Fort Shaw, Brady, Black Eagle, Fort Shaw, Power, Fort Logan On The Smith River, Eden, Fort Logan, Stockett, First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park, Ulm, Portage, Sluice Boxes State Park, Malmstrom Afb, Tracy, and Vaughn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
